conclusion: To solve the problem, we need to analyze the velocity-time graphs of Car A and Car B to determine the nature of their accelerations.
The graph shows the velocity v as a function of time t.
The slope of the velocity-time graph gives the acceleration. A positive slope indicates positive acceleration, and a negative slope indicates negative acceleration.
The slope of Car A's velocity-time graph is becoming less steep over time.
The decreasing steepness of the slope for Car A indicates that the acceleration of Car A is decreasing.
The slope at any point on the graph is the instantaneous acceleration.
As the slope decreases for Car A, the acceleration of Car A is decreasing.
The slope of Car B's velocity-time graph is becoming more steep over time.
The increasing steepness of the slope for Car B indicates that the acceleration of Car B is increasing.
As the slope becomes more negative, the acceleration of Car B is increasing in magnitude (but still negative).
The problem states that the magnitude of the acceleration of Car A is decreasing, which is consistent with the graph showing a decreasing slope.
The problem also states that the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B is increasing, which is consistent with the graph showing an increasing negative slope.
The magnitude of the acceleration of Car A is decreasing, while the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B is increasing.
